location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.6752 of 1850, from Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: Covering letter with an enclosure; a request by Malet that the Resident follow the Court of Directors' instructions whenever the occasion may offer. The enclosure (f 4) is an extract from a Despatch from the Court of Directors (dated 11 September 1850), reminding that 'small coins, copper plate inscriptions, ancient manuscripts and small portable vestiges of antiquity' be purchased at small expense for 'our museum' whenever possible.
